intro: Linaria dmitrievae, commonly known as the Dmitriev's toadflax, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of bright yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Linaria dmitrievae thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is a relatively rare species, often found in specific microhabitats within its native range.
